availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Blake (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Coleman Blake and Nancy Blake. Married to Elizabeth Burns Blake in Breckinridge County, Kentucky, on January 11, 1860. Attended school in Breckinridge County in 1850. Teamster in Breckinridge County, Kentucky in 1860. Farmer in Breckinridge County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 1, p. 110B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Cloverport, p. 537.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Breckinridge County, KY, September 1863, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Breckinridge County Marriages, Film 001877050, p. 11.
"John H. Blake (1837-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5026172, accessed May 31, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5026172.
